prompt: Close-up, photorealistic macro shot of the base of a Frederic Remington bronze sculpture, showcasing the foundry mark (Henry-Bonnard Bronze Co. or Roman Bronze Works) and edition number. The bronze surface is patinated with subtle green and brown hues. Soft, diffused lighting emphasizes the texture and detail of the casting. Shallow depth of field, with the foundry mark in sharp focus. Background is a blurred, neutral grey. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-evaluate-a-remington-bronze-image-1.png

prompt: An experienced art appraiser, wearing spectacles, carefully examining a Frederic Remington bronze using a magnifying glass. The bronze is 'The Bronco Buster'. The setting is a well-lit, professional appraisal office with shelves of art books in the background. Natural light streams in from a large window to the left. The appraiser's hands are gloved, and they are holding a small notebook. Focus is on the appraiser's hands and the bronze. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-evaluate-a-remington-bronze-image-2.png

prompt: Split-screen composition: On the left, a high-resolution image of a section of a Frederic Remington bronze showing intricate detail and quality craftsmanship. On the right, a similar section of a purported replica, highlighting flaws in the casting, lack of detail, and poor patination. Both images are under identical studio lighting, highlighting the differences. The title 'Authentic vs. Replica' is subtly overlaid. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-evaluate-a-remington-bronze-image-3.png

prompt: A wide shot of a Frederic Remington bronze sculpture ('Coming Through the Rye') displayed in a museum setting. The statue is illuminated by focused spotlights, casting dramatic shadows. The background is blurred, showing other sculptures and museum visitors in the distance. The overall atmosphere is elegant and refined. The bronze is presented on a dark wooden plinth. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-evaluate-a-remington-bronze-image-4.png

prompt: A detailed view of the patina on a Frederic Remington bronze sculpture, focusing on the subtle variations in color and texture. The lighting is soft and even, revealing the depth and richness of the patina. The background is a dark, blurred canvas, emphasizing the sculpture's surface. Include subtle reflections of light on the bronze. The composition emphasizes the artistry and craftsmanship of the patina application. --ar 16:9
name: how-to-evaluate-a-remington-bronze-image-5.png
